# Question

Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

```julia
function clean_column(col::String)
    return strip(lowercase(replace(col, [" ", "-"] => "_")))
end
```

This function does the following:

1. `strip`: Removes any leading or trailing whitespace characters from the string.
2. `lowercase`: Converts the entire string to lowercase.
3. `replace([" ", "-"] => "_")`: Replaces all occurrences of spaces and hyphens with an underscore.

Note that this function does not handle edge cases such as multibyte characters or non-alphanumeric characters other than spaces and hyphens. If you need to support a wider range of characters, you may need to use a regex or a more complex substitution strategy.
